description: Dive into "Brighton Snapshots: Capture the Coast" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Brighton Snapshots: Capture the Coast

places.generalDescription: Brighton Pier is a popular tourist spot dominating the seafront with its traditional British charm. While it's not dog-friendly, the beachfront from the pier to the Marina welcomes furry friends and offers stunning sea views. Nearby, you can hop on the Volks Electric Railway, created by Victorian engineer Magnus Volks, providing a unique way to explore the area. Visitors can enjoy recreational activities and witness mesmerizing murmurations of starlings while taking in breathtaking views of the sea.

sources.snippet: The iconic Brighton Palace Pier is Brightonâ€™s equivalent of the famous Las Vegas sign. Get your crew together for a stroll down the pier, and capture the retro aesthetic of funfair rides, arcade games and food stalls, for a photoshoot straight out of a vintage scrapbook. The pier comes alive at night, with bars, rides and games lit in glowing fairy lights and colourful arcade lighting, making it the perfect place for an evening shoot.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Photo Spots In Brighton

sources.snippet: And both London and Brighton seem to be home to the most shareable locations with two landmarks in both cities making the top 5 in the UK overall. Infact, Brits seem to love their home turf so much, that when given the option to spend Â£500 on travel anywhere in the world â€“ the saving youâ€™d get from buying a top-end smartphone â€“ the Lake District came in a close second, just following Paris.
sources.shortName: UKâ€™s top photo spots and their exact coordinates!

sources.snippet: Another must-see is the cityâ€™s pier, which has every ounce of classic seaside charm you could wish for, including candy floss, a rollercoaster and plenty of seagulls ready to pinch your chips from you. My favourite time to visit is out of the high season, when it is basically empty. I donâ€™t know why, but the lack of people around seems to give it even more character.
sources.shortName: A Photographer's Guide to Brighton

sources.snippet: Brighton Pier isnâ€™t just for roller coasters and candy flossâ€”itâ€™s a playground for lovebirds too!. Picture this: you and your partner being silly kids again with the dazzling lights of the arcade as your backdrop. The Brighton pier offers a kaleidoscope of colors, games, and rides that will turn your wedding photos into a whirlwind of fun and excitement.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Brighton Wedding Photo locations from a fun local photographer

sources.snippet: And whilst youâ€™re down on the beachfront, you have to check out the famous Brighton Pier and capture it in all its gaudy glory!. Not only is it a good Instagram spot, but itâ€™s also classic seaside fun at its finest!. Donâ€™t worry if your mates are reluctant, theyâ€™ll eventually succumb to the pier pressureâ€¦ (weâ€™ll see ourselves out)!
sources.siteName: GoHen Blog - Make Memories That Last A Lifetime!
sources.shortName: 15 of the Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

sources.snippet: Head down to the pier after taking a few iconic photographs at the Brighton Pavillon. Brighton has an amazing pier that draws crowds from all over the world. There is lots to do if you want a natural and fun session, from a tasty treat to the amusements at the very end of the pier.
sources.shortName: Best places for engagement photography in Brighton

places.name: Brighton Palace Pier

reviews.text:
We visited this lovely,nostalgic pier in July. It was midweek but before the summer holidays and still had plenty of families enjoying the amusements,stalls,shops,food outlets and fairground rides.
The pier has plenty of seating and offers exceptional views of the beautiful beaches on both sides.
If you wish to partake of the great selection of rides,it works out cheaper to work out which ones you want to ride and buy a card instead of individual tokens.
The ice creams were also absolutely delicious ðŸ˜‹

Nice to walk around and enjoy the sea view, but the visit is quite short. The pier is mostly filled with attractions, arcade games, and lots of food stalls (churros, donuts, etc.), so not much else to really do. Still, it's a beautiful spot and worth seeing for the view over the sea and the coastline.

Brighton Palace Pier is the heart of the city's seaside charm. A lovely place to stroll along the beach, enjoy the sea breeze, and take in the views - even when the waves are a little wild. The pier is full of fun attractions and games, perfect for families, couples, or friends. At night, the lights create a magical atmosphere that makes it a must-see when visiting Brighton.

places.address: Madeira Dr, Brighton, BN2 1TW, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton Palace Pier, which opened in 1899, is a historic and thrilling destination offering fairground rides, bars, restaurants, and stunning sea views. Visitors can enjoy street performers and ocean vistas before exploring popular eateries and bars inside the pier. The boardwalk offers opportunities for souvenir shopping while indulging in sweet treats. Families can delight in arcade games, midway attractions, sideshow entertainment, and exhilarating roller coasters.

sources.snippet: Brightonâ€™s Grade-II listed pleasure pier (which is considered the finest ever built) with fairground rides, bars and restaurants stretching out into the sea.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Things to do in Brighton in 2025 According to Locals

sources.snippet: Not only do you have the seafront with all the interesting characters and the vintage details you also have the beautiful Palace Pier which is a Grade II* listed pleasure pier that was established in 1899. Long walkways, a funfair with original rides all allow for some minimalist or detailed colour or black and white street photography images. I couldn't resist capturing this guy who was walking with his bright orange coat on, looking fairly melancholy.
sources.shortName: Brighton Street Photography - Composition Tips and Great Locations for Photographers

sources.snippet: Famously known for itâ€™s colourful twinkling lights and fun games, this pier is the place to go for a fun engagement photo shoot. We can see how competitive you are on the arcade games, grab some refreshing ice-cream or the best Fish and chips (careful of the seagulls tho!) and explore the fairground. I promise this amazing place will bring out the child in you!
sources.shortName: Best Locations for Engagement Shoot in Brighton as of 2024

sources.snippet: Brighton Palace Pier (also known as â€˜Brighton Pierâ€™) is a Grade II listed pier in the city centre of Brighton and is the only pier thatâ€™s still in operation. Itâ€™s an entertainment venue with fairground rides, coastal views and places to grab food and drink. It has millions of visitors every year and is regularly featured in film, TV and books.
sources.shortName: Belle's Top Insta Spots In Brighton â€“
Best photo locations in Brighton revealed

sources.snippet: No trip to Brighton would be complete without a trip to Brighton Palace Pier. With its kitsch charm and decoration, there are many shops (open from the 12th April), stalls and viewpoints that are crying out for a photograph!. You may even want to take a picture of your favourite people in one of the wooden cut outs that dot the walkway.
sources.shortName: Brightonâ€™s Most Instagrammable Spots

sources.snippet: Brightonâ€™s Palace Pier is arguably the most photogenic spots in the city â€“ as well as being a really fun day out. 62,000 lightbulbs light up the pier of an evening, so you can imagine how thatâ€™s going to brighten up your grid. But whatever time you decide to visit, watch out for the seagulls, they arenâ€™t afraid to steal your food!
sources.shortName: Brighton Instagram Spots For Your Next Grid Pic

sources.snippet: Easily the cityâ€™s most exciting location, Palace Pier is a symbol of our iconic seaside town. Grab yourself some hot donuts, a bag of freshly fried fish and chips and stroll down to the amusement arcade. As the promenade stretches out to the sea, the backdrop of the Pierâ€™s famous helter skelter makes for the ideal snap.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

sources.snippet: â‡’ On a busy day, they'll sell 1,200 portions of fish and chips to their hungry visitors. â‡’ Oh, and it's the most Instagrammed pier in England - 341k Instagram pics can't be wrong!. This post is an updated verison of a piece originally posted in 2018 in collaboration with Eyesite, Brighton.
sources.shortName: Top Selfie Spots

sources.snippet: Easily top of the most Instagrammable places in Brighton list. The famous Brighton Palace Pier is the most photographed landmark in the town. We advise heading down early in the morning, or just before sunset, for the best possible lighting and the least amount of people.
sources.shortName: 9 Most Instagrammable Places In Brighton

sources.snippet: In stark contrast, Brighton Palace Pier is a vibrant hive of activity attracting millions of visitors each year. This pier opened in 1899 and has been in operation ever since. It features a fun fair, amusement arcades and countless food stalls and bars.
sources.shortName: Brighton Street Photographers Guide â€¢ Best Locations & Tips

sources.snippet: With tonnes of rides, including dodgems and the Booster, there's something for everyone. It's mega Insta-friendly, and we recommend going at night (there are so many pretty lights). Find the Pier along (you guessed it) the beach.
sources.shortName: 10 of The Most Instagrammable Spots in Brighton
8 Most Instagrammable Places In Brighton

places.name: Brighton Palace Pier

reviews.text:
We visited this lovely,nostalgic pier in July. It was midweek but before the summer holidays and still had plenty of families enjoying the amusements,stalls,shops,food outlets and fairground rides.
The pier has plenty of seating and offers exceptional views of the beautiful beaches on both sides.
If you wish to partake of the great selection of rides,it works out cheaper to work out which ones you want to ride and buy a card instead of individual tokens.
The ice creams were also absolutely delicious ðŸ˜‹

Nice to walk around and enjoy the sea view, but the visit is quite short. The pier is mostly filled with attractions, arcade games, and lots of food stalls (churros, donuts, etc.), so not much else to really do. Still, it's a beautiful spot and worth seeing for the view over the sea and the coastline.

Brighton Palace Pier is the heart of the city's seaside charm. A lovely place to stroll along the beach, enjoy the sea breeze, and take in the views - even when the waves are a little wild. The pier is full of fun attractions and games, perfect for families, couples, or friends. At night, the lights create a magical atmosphere that makes it a must-see when visiting Brighton.

places.address: Madeira Dr, Brighton, BN2 1TW, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Royal Pavilion in Brighton is a unique and distinctive palace built for King George IV, featuring an Asian-style architecture that resembles the Taj Mahal. Constructed in three stages starting from 1787, this former royal residence boasts restored rooms such as the Banqueting Room, The Saloon, and The Great Kitchen. Surrounded by Pavilion Gardens, it has been well-maintained over the years and is a popular filming location for various movies.

sources.shortName: 27 Best Things to do in Brighton in 2025 According to Locals

sources.snippet: This exotic building in the centre of Brighton was built by King George IV in 1787 as a seaside retreat before he was king. Heavily influenced by both Chinese and Indian fashion (with Mughal and Islamic architectural elements) the Royal Pavilion is a striking contrast to the more classic Georgian style of Brighton sea front, and well worth a visit, (and a quick photo!). Follow @devotedtopink on Instagram
sources.shortName: Brighton Instagram Spots For Your Next Grid Pic

sources.snippet: I simply couldnâ€™t pass over the stunning Royal Pavilion in the heart of Brighton!. The Pavilion and Prince Regent (later crowned King George IV) are intertwined with Brightonâ€™s history and its journey to becoming a go-to destination. I highly recommend visiting the public gardens around the Pavilion where youâ€™ll find many photo opportunities â€“ some highly creative and others more tried and trusted.
sources.shortName: Brighton photography guide

sources.snippet: Arguably Brightonâ€™s most historic and iconic landmark, the beautiful domes and Indian inspired architecture provide the setting for an ultimate photo opportunity. Surrounded by Pavilion Gardens, you can sit a soak in the sunshine and views all summer, or ice skate round the Pavilion rink in winter months. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

sources.snippet: According to the data, the best photo location in Brighton is The Royal Pavilion. Also known as Brighton Pavilion, this Grade I listed former royal residence was built as a seaside retreat for George, Prince of Wales in 1787. Itâ€™s now a public attraction, iconic wedding venue and museum with over 400,000 visitors per year.
sources.shortName: Belle's Top Insta Spots In Brighton â€“

sources.snippet: As you get closer to the seas, some of the more familiar tourist spots begin to appear. You canâ€™t not stop for a look at the cityâ€™s Royal Pavilion, a former royal residence that was built between 1787 and 1823. It looks totally out of place and, in most other cities, would look plain strange.
sources.shortName: A Photographer's Guide to Brighton

sources.snippet: This list wouldn't be complete without Brighton's Royal Pavilion. This historic building is one of the most exotic buildings in England. The dazzling architecture is the perfect subject for a pic, and with hundreds of rooms, you'll never be short of a pic for the 'gram.
sources.shortName: 10 of The Most Instagrammable Spots in Brighton

sources.snippet: An exotic palace in the centre of Brighton with a colourful history, the Royal Pavilion mixes British royalty with style from China and India. Your Instagram followers will never guess that youâ€™re in Englandâ€¦. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Brighton

sources.snippet: The Royal Pavilion is a palace and a Grade I listed former royal residence in the centre of town. Itâ€™s also one of the most Instagrammable places in Brighton!. The palace itself is beautiful to look at from the many surrounding gardens.
sources.shortName: 9 Most Instagrammable Places In Brighton

sources.snippet: This stunning Grade I listed property isnâ€™t your traditional British building and we absolutely adore it for it. Impressive on the outside, jaw-dropping on the inside â€“ we donâ€™t know which we preferred!
sources.siteName: GoHen Blog - Make Memories That Last A Lifetime!
sources.shortName: 15 of the Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

sources.snippet: The Royal Pavilion is an exotic palace and is a Grade I listed former royal residence in the centre of town. Itâ€™s also one of the most Instagrammable places in Brighton!
sources.shortName: 8 Most Instagrammable Places In Brighton

sources.snippet: When you think about iconic buildings in Brighton, the Royal Pavilion is always one of the first to come to mind and really it's no surprise, I mean, look at it!
sources.shortName: Top Selfie Spots

places.name: Royal Pavilion

reviews.text: So wonderfully over the top, I particularly enjoyed the Colour exhibition which offered a fascinating insight into the use and development of colour. Not my first visit, but there's always something new to see. Highly recommended. The gift shop is a mine of must have books and decorative items. I love the plate I bought.

Quite the amazing experience and not what I expected.  We are not royal followers but loved this place.  Indian style architecture on the exterior with much more east asian influenced art on the interior.  Gorgeous interiors with so much detail, the opulence of it all astounded us and made us sad at the same time.  Amazingly well restored to its original state.  Even the behind the scenes like the kitchen were impressive.  Spent about 45 minutes.  National Art Pass had free admission included.

I didn't go inside the Royal Palace. This royal building is completely different from the general Victorian era and is quite historically valuable. If you like the style of Chinese and Indian elements, you should buy a ticket to visit. I believe it will be a good trip.

places.address: 4/5 Pavilion Buildings, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1EE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton Beach, though covered in pebbles, is a popular spot for sunbathing and swimming during the English summer. The beachside promenade offers plenty to explore, making it an ideal place for a leisurely walk. Located on the west side of Brighton Palace Pier, this area boasts prominent attractions. A short one-hour train journey from London makes it a convenient escape for city dwellers seeking a day at the beach without traveling far.

sources.snippet: Brightonâ€™s pebble beach isnâ€™t your ordinary sandy shoreline, and thatâ€™s precisely why itâ€™s perfect for your wedding photos!. Kick off your shoes and you walk along the shoreline or embrace the summer business. The sea will add a bit of calmness while you enjoy this time for yourselves and the picturesque West Pier ruins will bring a touch of romance.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Brighton Wedding Photo locations from a fun local photographer

sources.snippet: The beach and seafrontâ€¦ This is for you if you like a summery and beachy vibe for your photos. But you might have to share the space with lots of other people. Specifically, over summer, the beaches between Brighton and Hove can get very busy.
sources.siteName: Family photography and films | Anja Poehlmann
sources.shortName: Best outdoor photo locations in Brighton&Hove

sources.snippet: Strolling along the seafront on Kingâ€™s Road, youâ€™re blessed with views across Brightonâ€™s famous beach. Itâ€™s a great spot for people-watching.
sources.shortName: A Photographer's Guide to Brighton

places.name: Brighton Beach

reviews.text: Brighton Beach is one of my favourite places to spend time. The view of the sea is so wide and calming - just being there helps me relax and clear my mind. It's a perfect spot for a peaceful walk, sitting by the shore, or just enjoying the sound of the waves. The atmosphere is always nice, and it's a great escape from the busy city. Highly recommended for anyone who loves the sea and peaceful vibes.

The beach is a great place to sit and relax but wow, it's got so rough compared to a few years ago.
This isn't a place I'd spend more than a day at.
Lots of hen parties, drunks and quite a few homeless people. It was unnerving and I will not be visiting again in a hurry.
Much quieter/safer in Hove.

I really enjoy Brighton Beach and have visited multiple times. The beach itself is covered with pebbles, which I personally love. On this trip, I also had the chance to experience the Brighton i360, located right on the seafront. It's a great spot if you want panoramic views from above.
Unfortunately, the weather turned cloudy during our visit, so the views weren't as clear as I had hoped. Still, I think I prefer pebble beaches over sandy ones, which is why Brighton remains one of my favourites.

places.address: 4 Madeira Dr, Brighton, BN2 1ET, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Hove Park is a sprawling public park with lush lawns, colorful flower beds, and tall trees, providing a perfect setting for leisurely walks and outdoor activities. The park offers various amenities including playgrounds, sports facilities such as football pitches, tennis and basketball courts, and an outdoor gym. Visitors can also enjoy the miniature steam railway and the Fingermaze sculpture. It's an ideal spot for picnics or feeding ducks at the large pond.

sources.snippet: Hove Park is right by BASVIK college and has some great views of the city. It is a less crowded than the other parks in the city, has lovely gardens and an open air theatre.
sources.shortName: Best places for engagement photography in Brighton

places.name: Hove Park

reviews.text:
Large park with a variety of things to do. A well maintained playground that is sectioned off from dogs, a wide, rolling path encircles the whole park with plenty of benches and bins along the way.
Great for runners but maybe not cyclists as there are a lot of dogs and children running about. It's very family friendly and there are football and basketball courts, toilets, climbing rocks, a slide, a model railway and large patches of grass for picnics.

Nice for a good stroll.

Football pitches and Tennis courts at one end (must be booked), cafe is nice (food and drink at a reasonable price, with some seating inside, more available outside), kids park, presumably a bowls area, paths around the edge of a large green space, and some tree cover around the place. There is a miniature railway at the other end of the park, not sure if and when it runs or price, but looks a nice little ride.

The park serves as a pleasant escape for a leisurely stroll after a long day in the city. Surrounding the area are several amenities, including a cafÃ©, tennis courts, and a miniature railway. While the main section of the park tends to be quite crowded during after-school hours, it remains an enjoyable destination. However, after a few visits, the experience can start to feel somewhat monotonous.

places.address: Goldstone Cres, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3 6BG, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton i360 is a futuristic glass pod with a cocktail bar that offers breathtaking views of the ocean and city. Families visiting Brighton can enjoy the seafront area, with its 4-mile-long beach, old-school pier rides, and SEA LIFE Brighton. The charming Queens Hotel provides family rooms right on the beach, while The Claremont in Hove offers a quieter option with generous guest rooms in a Victorian villa.

sources.snippet: Similar to the Eye in London, Brighton i360 is an innovative project that has created an iconic landmark on the famous Brighton seafront at the landward end of the former West Pier. For the best views over Brighton and some great instagram shots, this observation deck is where youâ€™ll find just that. At 162m high, as you can imagine, itâ€™s also one of the best places for sunset photo opportunities in Brighton!
sources.shortName: 9 Most Instagrammable Places In Brighton

sources.snippet: Thatâ€™s because it dominates the city skyline and is situated right on Brighton Beach, opposite the West Pier ruins. The i360, which opened in 2016, is a glass viewing platform that elevates to 160 metres high. The i360 is an interesting backdrop to use when composing your street photographs.
sources.shortName: Brighton Street Photographers Guide â€¢ Best Locations & Tips

places.name: Brighton i360

reviews.text:
An awesome place to visit either before or after walking around Brighton.
It's not free but definitely not too expensive
You can appreciate the history of Brighton and the surrounding area from above, something that can only be realised once you get there.
To make it even better, they have a bar where a refreshing drink can be purchased.
Highly recommended.

Worth booking ahead to save a little money. Â£20 each person. The i360 holds maximum 200 people.
Views were fantastic. Best on a clear sunny day. Or evening sunset.
Bar service was great. We enjoyed a glass of champagne as we travelled upwards to the highest spot.

Went on a good day, was a nice experience the guys had champagne bottle at the top and pizza at the bottom. Great views we were lucky clear sky, no wait time. I am told online tickets are slightly cheaper. Perhaps ease up on the "pre-flight" red tape.

places.address: Lower Kings Road, Brighton, BN1 2LN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Upside Down House in Brighton is a unique and quirky beachfront attraction that offers visitors a fun and unconventional experience. This upside-down house, with its fully furnished interior including an inverted jukebox and mountain bike, provides the perfect backdrop for some truly creative and gravity-defying photos. The house features all the standard rooms of a typical home, but everything is flipped upside down, from the wooden floors on the ceiling to the furniture hanging above.

sources.snippet: If huts the right way around just arenâ€™t interesting enough for your feed, then look no further than Brightonâ€™s iconic upside-down house. Offering exactly what it promises from the title, this unique and quirky structure is a fully constructed house-sized beach hut built upside down. Get your gang together and try out some of the quirky leaning tower of Pisa style photos, where you can capture a shot where you seem about to be crushed by the house, or where you and your loved ones are pushing it over.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Photo Spots In Brighton

sources.snippet: Back to the beachfront (yep, it really is where the party is at!), the Upside Down House is what it says on the tin and itâ€™s as great as it sounds. Falling from the ceiling, diving into the toilet â€“ who doesnâ€™t want their Insta feeds filled with that sort of content?
sources.siteName: GoHen Blog - Make Memories That Last A Lifetime!
sources.shortName: 15 of the Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

sources.snippet: An obvious pick for the Instagrammable places in Brighton list. The recently opened Upside Down House was built for photographers. From the outside, to the inside, you can have plenty of fun getting snap happy and creating mind boggling photos.
sources.shortName: 9 Most Instagrammable Places In Brighton

sources.snippet: This one needs no introduction, because if you see an upside down house, youâ€™re going to take a pic with it, right?. This one is just off Brighton beach, but you can find these scattered throughout the UK. Follow @skoneczs on Instagram
sources.shortName: Brighton Instagram Spots For Your Next Grid Pic

sources.snippet: The recently opened Upside Down House was built for photographers. From the outside, to the inside, you can have plenty of fun getting snap happy and creating mind boggling photos.
sources.shortName: 8 Most Instagrammable Places In Brighton

places.name: Upside Down House - Brighton

reviews.text:
Seriously good fun ðŸ˜ I was expecting an upside-down house but I wasn't expecting the crazy photo props and experience. The ladies working there were really helpful with taking photos and guiding things when you needed some help with how to position your body and camera to get the best shots.
Massive value for money and laughs xx

Such a shame we didn't get to go inside, but the outside is honestly just as much of an attraction! The bright turquoise beach-hut looks like it's landed on its roof in the middle of the seafront, so even if you don't go in, it makes for great photos. If you are on Brighton beach, just head towards the i360 and you'll spot it on the other side.

A Brighton must-see - the kind of fun that flips your day! ðŸ™ƒðŸ 

As someone who lives in Brighton, I've been to the Upside Down House so many times - and every visit is a new laugh! Whether you're going with friends, kids, or just in the mood to take fun, quirky pictures, it's such a unique experience.

The team is always super friendly, and the house itself? Full of surprises! You'll leave with a camera roll full of upside-down madness and a big smile on your face.

It's right on the seafront, so it's the perfect stop while exploring Brighton. If you haven't visited yet - what are you waiting for? This is one of those experiences that makes you feel like a kid again.

places.address: 42-43, Kings Road Arches, Brighton BN1 2LN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton seafront is a vibrant area with a mix of amusement arcades, souvenir shops, and traditional British sweet kiosks. The seafront is lined with various accommodation options, including hotels along the coast and smaller guest houses further inland. A Room With A View Brighton offers stunning vistas of the seafront and beach from its classic Georgian building in Kemp Town. Additionally, Brighton seafront is known for offering fantastic views of Starling Murmurations during the winter months.

sources.snippet: Easily the best place for creative street shots, Brighton seafront boasts shops, art galleries, bars and restaurants. Some are built into the historical arched promenade architecture which is comprised of interesting textures and shapes that can be worked into your compositions. In this shot, I was enticed by the colours and the textures in the shop's facades and the table and chairs.
sources.shortName: Brighton Street Photography - Composition Tips and Great Locations for Photographers

sources.snippet: Brighton has a fantastic promenade that makes for a lovely backdrop for your engagement photography session. I recommend walking from Brighton Pier and heading west if you want shops and crowds, and east if you seek a bit more of a secluded spot. But going early in the the morning will promise you a good amount of privacy.
sources.shortName: Best places for engagement photography in Brighton

places.name: Brighton Seafront

reviews.text:
A Breathtaking Coastal Escape â€“ From Brighton to Eastbourne!
The iconic cliffs stretching from Brighton to Eastbourne are an absolute must-see! This stunning coastline offers some of England's most spectacular views, with dramatic white cliffs, rolling green hills, and endless sea horizons.
Of course, no visit to Brighton is complete without indulging in classic Fish & Chips on the historic pier-a true British tradition! With its charming seaside atmosphere, breathtaking views, and a wide, warm beach, Brighton Pier is the perfect spot to relax and soak up the coastal vibe.

Walk the pavement alongside main A259 take care as uneven tarmac repair. A bumpy ride for wheelchair users. Good view to level below that runs alongside the pebble beach. It is now lined with outside tables tied down to a wide variety of bars and eateries. some have spent a lot of money and design effort to make them look more appealing than the competition. Some are small some are huge with live entertainment. All very nice. Free public toilets ca be found on this lower lever. There are free volley ball and basketball courts to use on a first come first serve basis
You can find the Brighton Fishing museum down there. Along with arty gifts and seaside essentials for the kids. I think it caters more for the adults. A lovely old original Carousel deck chairs and loungers available for hire.

Overhyped is my opinion.
Very commercial, nearby parking costs a bomb. When we reached the nearby parking was closed and we paid at Lanes parking, and was it expensive.
We stayed for only and hour and left.
I did not enjoy what this place is.

places.generalDescription: Preston Park, located in Brighton, is the city's largest urban park spanning 63 acres. It offers a range of activities including playgrounds, pitches, and a manor house. The park hosts various events such as concerts, fairs, and circuses. Visitors can enjoy picnics, sports like tennis and basketball, or explore the rock garden with its hidden waterfall and scenic views. Additionally, there are nearby eateries to satisfy any cravings after a day at Preston Park.

sources.snippet: Preston Park is a really large park in Brighton and so itâ€™s not too hard to find a secluded spot away from the crowds. The Rose Garden at Preston Park is really lovely when in bloom as well!
sources.shortName: Best places for engagement photography in Brighton

places.name: Preston Park

reviews.text: Full of joy and friendly dogs. Tennis courts, a cafe, lots of open green spaces. Too busy for us unless it's raining haha x

Fantastic place to bring the children nice long walks and just across the road there's a rock garden that the little ones can have an adventure going up and down the rock path.
There's a sandy area with swings and slides and a few cafes on site what more do you need for a great day out
I love going to the rock gardens over the road with my son and partner to see the fishes and to go in the little waterfall

places.address: Preston Rd, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 6SD, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton Open Market is a popular marketplace offering a variety of goods, including local produce, clothing, crafts, and delicious vegan treats. It's the city's only outdoor covered market and features over 40 unique stalls and traders. Visitors can support small local businesses while enjoying quality food and handcrafted products. The market also houses several cafes, artist studios, and quirky gift stalls. It's a great place to escape the tourist crowds and soak up the local atmosphere.

sources.shortName: 27 Best Things to do in Brighton in 2025 According to Locals

sources.snippet: Whilst it might not be the same as a vibrant market on foreign shores, there are still plenty of stalls selling a myriad of foodstuffs and trinkets which make for a cool little photo collage. Go for the photos and who knows what you might end up picking up!
sources.siteName: GoHen Blog - Make Memories That Last A Lifetime!
sources.shortName: 15 of the Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

places.name: Brighton City Open Market

reviews.text: I used to go there a few times a week when I used to live nearby. Went there yesterday for the 1st time in years & I was very pleased to see that the atmosphere was still the same. Small shops, good cheese, fresh eggs, cheap books, nice coffee places & eateries, lovely communityâ¤ï¸

It's not a very big market but if you want to support local and small businesses, this is the place to come! It's very lively during Christmastime and you can find a range of items from crafts to sauces to cheese to books. There are many fantastic stalls and on the top floor there's some specialised shops as well. If you're passing by, it's definitely worth a short visit. You can also keep up with them on their social media to see which days there's going to be Makers' Markets (my personal favourite)

Came by late on a Monday around 5 pm, and unfortunately, most shops and stalls were closed. It seems like the market winds down early in the week. It might be a better idea to visit on busier days if you're looking for more options!

places.address: Marshalls Row, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 4JU, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Volks Electric Railway, established in 1883, is the oldest continuously operating electric railway globally. It runs along the seafront and offers a delightful one-mile ride with stunning views of the seaside. The railway was created by Magnus Volk, a local inventor and clockmaker's son. Along its route, passengers can enjoy attractions such as Sea Life Brighton, Brighton Palace Pier, the West Pier skeleton, and the Brighton i360.

sources.snippet: Running from the Palace Pier to Black Rock, the Volks Electric Railway is a narrow gauge service that delights tourists and young families alike. Opened by Magnus Volk in 1883, its small carriages run along the coast with views out to sea, passing through banks of wildflowers that are often covered with butterflies in summer.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Things to do in Brighton in 2025 According to Locals

sources.snippet: Volkâ€™s Electric Railway, the oldest continuously running, electric railway in the World, and a super-cute way to make your way down Madeira Drive to Brighton Marina fromt he centre of town. This vintage railway is also a great spot for some unique photos, especially in summer when itâ€™s surrounded by wildflowers. Follow @miriambernal80 on Instagram
sources.shortName: Brighton Instagram Spots For Your Next Grid Pic

places.name: Volk's Electric Railway

reviews.text: Reopened on April 5th 2025. The world oldest electric rail from Victorian era and still operating. recommend to take the full length and get off at the last stop (takes only about 10 minutes) where there is a very nice cafe called Reading Room.

Riding the Volk's Electric Railway was a fun experience, especially for the kids! It's a charming and unique way to travel along the Brighton seafront, and the historic character of the train adds to the overall fun.

At the end of the line, there isn't much to see or do right at the station itself, if you do not want to go the beach itself. However, if you're up for a short walk-about 25 minutes-you can head to the other side of Brighton Marina. From there, you'll get a beautiful view of the white chalk cliffs, and you can even walk along the cliffs for some stunning coastal scenery.

All in all, it's a great little adventure.

My partner and I both have health issues, so we decided to take this delightful little train from the pier to the other end and back again to save walking. The staff were all lovely and friendly, and explained all about the history of the railway and how it worked. The views of the beach are really nice and it is very cheap to ride, so well worth it,especially if you have kids.

places.address: 285 Madeira Dr, Brighton, BN2 1EN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton West Pier, a 19th-century pleasure pier, was destroyed by fire in 2003 and now stands as atmospheric remnants on the Brighton seafront. The Grade-listed pier has been part of a major regeneration scheme for Regency Square and the seafront. A futuristic tower has been commissioned to raise funds for rebuilding the historic pier and boost the city's economy.

sources.snippet: Today, only the sculptural remains of West Pier are left standing in the sea after it burnt down in 2003. Itâ€™s metal skeleton is an eerie addition to Brightonâ€™s seafront, but provides a beautiful silhouette against the backdrop of sunsets and cotton-candy skies. The featured work in this shot was created by local artist Lois Oâ€™Hara  â€“ read Brighton Journalâ€™s interview with her to find out more about her colourful work.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

sources.snippet: West Pier was first opened in 1866 as a leisure pier and offered its visitors a stroll out over the sea, along with performances in the theatre and music hall. The pier later fell into a state of disrepair and funding attempts to restore it were unsuccessful. Sadly, the fire of 2003 destroyed the West Pier apart from its metal frame and one of its fortune-tellers hut that survived, or so the local legend goes!
sources.shortName: Brighton photography guide

sources.snippet: Though a derelict pier does not sound the most obvious spot for a photograph, Brightonâ€™s West Pier somehow manages to look beautiful, wistful and little bit mysterious, making it perfect for a moody snap. Sitting in the water, the leftover structure stands stark against the skyline, making a wonderful backdrop for a couplesâ€™ photograph or as a centrepiece all on its own. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: Brightonâ€™s Most Instagrammable Spots

sources.snippet: Who would have thought a burnt-out pier could be such a photographic subject?. Iâ€™ve snapped pictures of this gem every time Iâ€™ve visited Brighton, but have to say that grabbing it silhouetted against an orange sunset is the best shot Iâ€™ve got so far â€“ in spite of it being taken on my phone!. When your subject is this good, itâ€™s difficult to take a bad photograph if it.
sources.shortName: A Photographer's Guide to Brighton

sources.snippet: Just down from the main entrance to Brighton Palace Pier is this view of the fair ground rides, that make Brighton seafront so magical. Capturing the helta skelta in the distance was our main objective, however there are plenty of photo opportunities available by simply walking up and down the pier. Grab a candy floss and get creative with all the fun fair vibes.
sources.shortName: 9 Most Instagrammable Places In Brighton

sources.snippet: The Brighton West Pier opened in 1866 and closed amid financial difficulties in 1975. Various winter storms, followed by two fires in 2003 reduced her to the continually decaying steel skeleton that remains today. In relation to street photography, this famous ruin is a great backdrop for your images.
sources.shortName: Brighton Street Photographers Guide â€¢ Best Locations & Tips

sources.snippet: The remaining shell of Brightonâ€™s West Pier has become more and more derelict since it closed in 1975, and with it brought a haunting beauty that is synonymous with this vintage seaside resort â€“ and a beautiful backdrop for your #OOTD shot. Follow @pamm_a_lamm on Instagram
sources.shortName: Brighton Instagram Spots For Your Next Grid Pic

sources.snippet: The derelict, Grade I listed, West Pier is a hot spot for seascapes and long exposure photography. In its beautiful broken state, you can always find a unique perspective and Exposure setting to shoot from. This shot was taken whilst standing on The Palace Pier.
sources.shortName: Brighton Street Photography - Composition Tips and Great Locations for Photographers

sources.snippet: While the West Pier may be a skeletal structure now, it remains a symbol of the enduring allure of Brightonâ€™s seafront. This iconic pier offers a captivating and somewhat haunting backdrop for wedding photos.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Brighton Wedding Photo locations from a fun local photographer

sources.snippet: Capturing the helta skelta in the distance was our main objective, however there are plenty of photo opportunities available by simply walking up and down the pier.
sources.shortName: 8 Most Instagrammable Places In Brighton

places.name: Brighton West Pier

reviews.text:
I know its not everyone's cup of tea but the west pier is a part of history. It provides nesting for alot of nature for local wildlife ðŸ¦ and alot of local artists ðŸ’ƒ ðŸ”¥ ðŸŽ¶ like to hang around this here
You can get some nice photos from this area

Slowly collapsing broken down pier. It's nice to look at

However a seagull flew and stole my hotdog around here five years ago.

9/10 nice view
Just wish I could go there with boat

A hauntingly beautiful landmark. The remains of the West Pier are iconic-especially at sunset when the silhouette glows against the sea. Great spot for photos and quiet reflection. Not much to do here, but it's a must-see if you're in Brighton.

places.address: Kings Rd, Brighton, BN1 2FL, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Hove Beach Huts are a vibrant and picturesque sight, reflecting the lively atmosphere of the city. These vintage-style huts come in a variety of colors and designs, making them perfect for photo shoots or as a backdrop for wedding adventures. They offer a delightful visual feast with their rainbow stripes, pastels, and bold patterns. Additionally, they are located near Brighton and provide an ideal setting for capturing memorable moments.

sources.snippet: For an instant shot straight out of a postcard, the colourful Hove Beach huts will add a rainbow burst to your shoot. Reflecting the vibrancy of the city, these vintage-style huts come in every conceivable colour, and look almost too picture-perfect to be real. Decorated in a range of rainbow stripes, cute pastels and bold designs, you are sure to find the perfect hut to be the backdrop for your shoot.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Photo Spots In Brighton

sources.snippet: The beach huts in Brighton and Hove are a popular choice, but the ones in Lancing are better. The beach huts on Lancing Beach are really big and colourful â€“ and just really beautiful!. It is often a bit less crowded here than in Brighton as well â€“ though The Perch really does draw the crowds with their food and Ultimate Hot Chocolate.
sources.shortName: Best places for engagement photography in Brighton

sources.snippet: Just a stoneâ€™s throw away from Brighton, Hove Beach Huts provide a vibrant backdrop for your wedding adventures. These iconic beach huts come in an array of colors, creating a delightful visual feast. Embrace the playfulness of colours and infuse your wedding album with a sense of seaside joy and coastal charm.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Brighton Wedding Photo locations from a fun local photographer

sources.snippet: Brighten up any rainy day by strolling along Hove Lawn beach huts. This most colourful part of the seaside has been around since the 1930s when they were first built. In warmer weather, the promenade is full of dog walkers, roller skaters and strollers whilst the opposite lawn is the ideal picnic location.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

sources.snippet: Possibly the most Insta-friendly Brighton attraction, the colourful cove beach huts will make your feed pop!. Vibrant, quirky and simply the perfect place for a photoshoot (you know youâ€™re a pop star deep down!), these quintessentially British seaside pods are a great little place to stock up on snaps.
sources.siteName: GoHen Blog - Make Memories That Last A Lifetime!
sources.shortName: 15 of the Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

sources.snippet: Keep heading down Kingsway towards Hove Lawns and youâ€™ll be rewarded with another slab of classic British seaside style: a row of beautifully coloured beach huts. Yet another bright and cheery photographic subject â€“ youâ€™ll be able to make your own postcards with a few snaps here!
sources.shortName: A Photographer's Guide to Brighton

sources.snippet: Another pop of colour in Brighton, Hove's Beach Huts are a must have for any university student's feed. I mean, if you don't have a pic in front of these, did you even study in Brighton?. The huts are famous for their quirkiness, and can be found along the beach in Kingsway.
sources.shortName: 10 of The Most Instagrammable Spots in Brighton

sources.snippet: These vintage seaside beach huts are the candy-cane backdrop of our dreams, and arguably Brightonâ€™s most iconic photo spot. Just make sure you wear your most colourful outfit if youâ€™re heading down to Hove beach this season. Follow @everyday_sazzle on Instagram
sources.shortName: Brighton Instagram Spots For Your Next Grid Pic

sources.snippet: These traditional, colourful huts make the perfect backdrop. These picturesque huts from holidays past are as timeless as you can get on any beach in the UK. Extending all the way into Hove, every hut is a colourful display and a work of art all its own.
sources.shortName: Top Selfie Spots

sources.snippet: Follow the promenade west of West Pier and youâ€™ll find yourself at Hove Lawns and the start of Hoveâ€™s Beach Huts.
sources.shortName: Brighton photography guide

places.name: Hove Beach Huts

reviews.text: Spectacular views and nice walks. Check out the cafe at the farm

Beautiful beach front, one of my favourite places to come and chill with the Mrs, not so busy, can just take in the sun and views of the ocean in peace.
once you have soaked up all the sun and had all the swimms you can easily drive down to Brighton beach front as it's just a mile away for some dinner with many options from fish and chips to steak houses

After dinner A stroll on the peir in the evening to end a perfect day.
Brighton is still Brighton. Happy, relaxed atmosphere, with lots of fun thing6to do for all ages and still not too expensive too boot!

places.address: Hove Lawns, Kingsway, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3 2PE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton Beach Bandstand, located on the seafront, offers beautiful views and a romantic atmosphere. It is a popular spot for dancing, live bands, and yoga sessions. The bandstand has been a favorite among locals since its opening in 1884 and was fully restored in 2009 to preserve its Victorian charm. It is often hired out for weddings and concerts, making it an exciting place to visit.

sources.snippet: Whilst youâ€™ll get some impressive photos whatever time you visit the Bandstand, weâ€™d recommend heading there at dawn or dusk to grab some really atmospheric snaps. This quaint structure is a glorious homage to the past with great views out across the channel. Sat in the shadow of the pier, you can tick off a few Brighton tourist attractions in quick succession.
sources.siteName: GoHen Blog - Make Memories That Last A Lifetime!
sources.shortName: 15 of the Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

sources.snippet: Now thatâ€™s an Instagrammable seafront bandstand if there ever was one. Just a short walk from the i360, the Bandstand is often flooded with photographers and newlyweds posing for their romantic memoirs. However, when it is quiet, this location in the city is the perfect sunset viewing point.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Instagrammable Places in Brighton

places.name: Brighton Beach Bandstand

reviews.text:
My second time at the beach in the UK! It's was cold but wonderful, the atmosphere was calm and less people around interfering in your pictures.

Didn't get a chance to swim due to the time we got there, but I got enough time to take pictures with all the lovely things I saw and was interested in ðŸ˜

This place is boring and average at best. It's just cause of the location but this thing is basically a backyard gazebo on the beach.

Loads of people come here for wedding photos. Me and my wife didn't cause everyone does and it's dumb but we laugh at people who do.

Also loads of other annoying people go on it and play music and dance together trying to look cool. They would look cooler if they weren't trying so hard in most cases.

Made in 1884 and redone in 2009

Relaxing area, god place where playing music, jamming and a lot of people dancing. Not everyday obviously.
Is a part of Brighton's landmark. Where often is possible see stunning sunset and not only
